job.name: Anomaly_Detection_In_HDFS_Nodes
job.tags: Anomaly Detection,Intrusion Detection,Log Analysis,Big Data,Samples,HDFS,Machine Learning,Analytics

variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.
variable.name: CONTAINER_PLATFORM

variable.description: If True, it will activate the use of GPU for the workflow tasks on the selected container platform.
variable.name: CONTAINER_GPU_ENABLED

variable.description: Name of the container image being used.
variable.name: CONTAINER_IMAGE

variable.description: Name of the Visdom service instance to use.
variable.name: VISDOM_INSTANCE_NAME

variable.description: If True, requests to Visdom are sent via a proxy server.
variable.name: VISDOM_PROXYFIED

variable.description: If True, a login in required for accessing the Visdom service.
variable.name: VISDOM_ENABLE_LOGIN

variable.description: Username to access the Visdom service.
variable.name: VISDOM_USERNAME

variable.description: Password to access the Visdom service.
variable.name: VISDOM_PASSWORD

variable.description: Working directory for the data space used to transfer files automatically between the workflow tasks.
variable.name: WORK_DIR

job.description: Detect anomalies in nodes reported in HDFS logs.

task.name: Log_Parser
task.description: Extract a group of event templates, whereby raw logs can be structured.

variable.description: URL of the raw log file that you need to parse.
variable.name: LOG_FILE

variable.description: URL of the CSV file that contains the different RegEx expressions of each possible pattern and their corresponding variables.
variable.name: PATTERNS_FILE

variable.description: Extension of the file where you will save the resulted structured logs.
variable.name: STRUCTURED_LOG_FILE

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

task.name: Feature_Vector_Extractor
task.description: Encode structured data into numerical feature vectors whereby machine learning models can be applied.

variable.description: ID of the entity that you need to represent (to group by).
variable.name: SESSION_COLUMN

variable.description: Index of the column containing the log patterns.[specific to features extraction from logs].
variable.name: PATTERN_COLUMN

variable.description: If True, the number of occurrence of each pattern per session is extracted.
variable.name: PATTERNS_COUNT_FEATURES

variable.description: Different variables that need to be considered to extract features according to their content.
variable.name: STATE_VARIABLES

variable.description: Different variables that need to be considered to count their distinct content.
variable.name: COUNT_VARIABLES

variable.description: If True, the state and count features per session are extracted.
variable.name: STATE_COUNT_FEATURES_VARIABLES

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

task.name: Split_Data
task.description: Separate data into training and testing sets.

variable.description: Float number within the range (0.0, 1.0), not including the values 0.0 and 1.0.
variable.name: TRAIN_SIZE

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

task.name: Predict_Model
task.description: Generate predictions using a trained model.

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

variable.description: Label/class column name.
variable.name: LABEL_COLUMN

task.name: Preview_Results
task.description: Preview the HTML results of the predictions.

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

variable.description: Format of the output
variable.name: OUTPUT_TYPE

variable.description: Maximum number of rows displayed in the output
variable.name: LIMIT_OUTPUT_VIEW

task.name: Visdom_Visualize_Results
task.description: Plot the different results obtained by a predictive model using Visdom.

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

variable.description: Label/class column name
variable.name: TARGET_CLASS

variable.description: Visdom endpoint to be used.
variable.name: VISDOM_ENDPOINT

task.name: Visdom_Service_Actions
task.description: Manage the life-cycle of Visdom PSA service.

variable.description: Service instance name.
variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME

variable.description: Service instance name.
variable.name: ACTION

variable.description: The service instance ID
variable.name: INSTANCE_ID

task.name: K_Means
task.description: K-means algorithm aims to partition n observations into k clusters in which each observation belongs to the cluster with the nearest mean, serving as a prototype of the cluster.

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

variable.description: A set of specific variables (usecase-related) that are used in the model training process.
variable.name: INPUT_VARIABLES

variable.description: Function used to evaluate the quality of a given pipeline for the clustering problem.
variable.name: SCORING

variable.description: If False, the task will be ignored and will not be executed
variable.name: TASK_ENABLED

variable.description: Label/class column name.
variable.name: LABEL_COLUMN

variable.description: Number of splits you want to perform on the data.
variable.name: N_SPLITS

task.name: Visdom_Service_Start
task.description: Start the Visdom server as a service.

variable.description: The name of the service. Please keep the default value for this variable.
variable.name: SERVICE_ID

variable.description: Service instance name.
variable.name: INSTANCE_NAME

variable.description: Container platform used for executing the workflow tasks.
variable.name: ENGINE

variable.description: True if a proxy is needed to protect the access to this model-service endpoint
variable.name: PROXYFIED

task.name: Wait_for_Signal
task.description: Enable users to interact with running jobs via signals.

variable.description: Signal waiting for a notification to be performed.
variable.name: SIGNALS
